title: Loves lunacie. Or, Mad Besses fegary Declaring her sorrow, care and mone, which may cause many a sigh and grone: a young-man did this maid some wrong, wherefore she writ this mournfull song. To the tune of, The mad mans Morris.
author: Crimsal, Richard.
publisher: printed for Iohn Wright the younger, and are to bee sold at the upper end of the Old-Bayley,
notes: Signed at the end: Richard Climsull.
Verse - "Poore Besse, mad Besse, so they call me,".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
